snippet: Across the country, businesses have recovered while the public sector has struggled, and Detroit may be the most extreme example of a city’s dual fates diverging.
abstract: Private industry is booming in Detroit, even as city's finances are in ruins, pointing up widening economic divide; demographers say much of economic growth is focused around midtown and downtown areas, small fraction of vast city that is otherwise wrestling with vacant homes, empty blocks, darkened streetlights, fear of crime and overburdened police officers.
lead_paragraph: Across the country, businesses have recovered while the public sector has struggled, and Detroit may be the most extreme example of a city’s dual fates diverging.

headline.seo: A Private Boom Amid Detroit’s Public Blight
headline.main: A Private Boom Amid Detroit’s Public Blight
headline.print_headline: A Private Boom Amid Detroit’s Public Blight
